Fix Label styles baselineShift and typographicCase so they work as documented.  The documentation is from TLF.
Bugs: partial fix for SDK-25169, SDK-25210
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

This fixes the performance issue in truncateText() while maintaining the word-wrapping added for https://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-23931.  If a word wrapped to the next line it may fit on the line we are truncating if a character or characters are truncated.

If there is an extra line, rather than starting at the end of it, we start at the first word boundary, and work backwards, recomposing for each dropped atom until the text fits.  If the extra line is long there can be many recompositions.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

RichText needs to recompose if the contentHeight isn't the same as the unscaledHeight since the content height could be an estimated height which doesn't all the text lines composed yet to back up that height.

baselinePosition should always return a non-0 value, even if there are no text lines so that components that use the baseline for positioning, such as ButtonBar, don't jump around when the width of the component is changed.
Tests run: checkintests, cyclone on Label, RichText
